Performing LogSkip can vary depending on the version & specific setup but this is how it is performed. 1 start where LogSkip is possible. 2 stand on top of the log. 3 quickly press and hold Z to enter first person mode then quickly press A to jump. 4 profit. FYI glitches can be inconsistent & may prevent players from finishing the game in a legitimate manner. If interested in speedrunning Paper Mario stick to verified & accepted methods rather than attempting glitches or exploits Cheer100

Third one is literally just have Full Sync, counter the top mettaur with Crakshot, then move down and heatpress the middle
Thats the first fight I think?
The second fight has the pufferfish
First 2 fights have Gunner and Piranha
First fight: Crakshot mettaur with counter, move down HeatPress. If you do it quickly, you should almost always counter the Piranha
Second fight: You can do it 2 ways, the fastest is to move up and counter hit the puffer with Crakshot, then move down and counter the Gunner with HeatPress
There's a buffered movement setup you can do on the second fight, but its tricky to describe
this fire dude you're playing as seems op af lol
He has some really consistent setups for these early fights
Up left, bait the mettaur to attack. Move down, right, then fire Crakshot. Try to line everyone up in the middle for HeatPress

Long hair secrets: only use shampoo on your roots
Apparently they don't teach this to people who AFAB on a general basis? Idk why it's just useful life knowledge
Why only the roots? I have super long hair and use soo much each time I wash it 🤣
It opens up the cuticle and causes all the natural oils and everything to be rinsed out, which makes it dry and unmanageable
The only place you need shampoo is at the roots where the oil builds up from your scalp
Yeah shampoo is inherently like, not good for your hair

There's a trick to get into the final boss level early that's extremely tricky and RNG based
Final trick at the end of 40-50min run
You basically jam Spyro's hitbox into that of a mob by squishing yourself between the mob and a wall, in this case
Since your hitbox intersects with another that you're NOT supposed to be in, the game freaks out and launches you out at High Speeds
It's used through all three of the Spyro games but they're pretty inconsistent.
Just what everyone loves at the end of an intense run: an RNG-based trick

it is absolute fact though that you don't have full access to every HP memory and powerful chips first run. because BN4 locks those behind later runs

wait, can you miss HPmemories if you don't grab 'em all before another NG+?
true, but the HP memories are still limited
iirc BN4 does a silly thing where BMD/PMD rewards are linked to how many times you've found it
so if you, say, don't get one til the 2nd run it'll have the reward from the 1st run, but the second time you get it on the third run overall will have the second reward
so they're not permanently missable, but you would have to do extra runs to get everything
and while BN4 has the Normal, then Hard, then Super Hard for each run, after that it's always Super Hard
but i maintain that due to having access to your full arsenal by the time you hit Super Hard, it's actually the easiest difficulty

looks like there's a bunch of little hits getting in there?
When a Prism takes damage, it deals that same amount of damage to everything around it, but without actually counting as a hit (so no flinching or frames invincibility happen). The weirdness comes from the Prism "colliding" with something: every "frame" that an object is inside a Prism, it will do "contact damage" all without counting as a hit. Cheer100
ok, makes sense. Thanks for the explanation

in terms of controllers nowadays: for internals, them joysticks being potentiometer based v being so called "hall effect" joysticks is a baane for their durability
as much as N64 controllers due to their overall build nature sucked, their joysticks in design were hall effect just in a plastic casing which wore out. so if you slapped a more durable casing on that one, those would endure WAY more wear'n tear

Rocky Rodent, also known as Rodential Rockius, is a rock-dwelling rodent. Its name is derived from its habit of burrowing into rock faces for its shelter and because it has a rocky appearance. The Rocky Rodent is a hardy predator and a tireless forager, and is believed to be the ancestor of many modern mammal species.

How many calories does mario burn in a day? Well, SMB has 56 mushrooms, 1 mushroom has 5 calories making a total of 280 available calories. SMB released september 13, 1985 and the next game with mushrooms was june 3, 1986 leaving an interval of 263 days for 1.1 calories per day. Conclusion: Mario starved to death in late 1985. Cheer100

Spheres are...  I think Phantom can explain it better. XD
Basically it's like... one sphere usually has at least one thing required for progressing to the other sphere?
Oh ok. Thanks for the knowledge
i always struggle to expalin spheres
like in spongebob 4 hrs later.

Oh, Paper Mario does have spheres too.
Never heard it though idk man I'm new
like your starting items are sphere zero, and everything you are able to get with your starting items would be sphere 1, then items you acquire from your sphere 1 gear would be sphere 2, and it carries over until you finish
So... To make an example for that, say you need Bow to get into Shy Guy's Toybox, and Bow is in Sphere 2, you need something to get Bow in sphere 1, and something to get that something in Sphere 0.
Thanks guys now I get it
think of spheres as the side quest to get giants knife in OoT
Sorry if I got a bit carried away in the explanation. XD

i had a new one today
customer came in and immediately went "live agent"
well you're already with one so
also i see people complaining about no online co-op missing the fact that there is online co-op
in local, you can't bump into other players and if a dead player bumps into a live one they're revived. in online you can't bump into other players and if a dead player bumps into a live one they're revived
online players are more transparent but their actions are transmitted. you can also place cardboard cutouts as stand-ins to revive folks
there's also a "heart rating" where the more helpful you are the higher the rating
and you aren't forced to play with randos, you can make friend lobbies
you can also specifically race the stages and it'll time it
this all is related to mario wonder?
it's basically just NSMB multiplayer just you can't touch the other players lol

i was a cashier for years i'm quite familiar
I worked at a bar for a long time. I've seen plenty of idiots
fun fact: i had to deal with a karen in my first week as a cashier. we were opening a brand new restaurant so the regional manager was there helping. a soccer mom comes up and complains about the line since we just opened
she whined and complained about how it was a 5 hour drive back to southern california with 15 hungry girls and they needed food now and thus were more important
These girls came in way back and 1996 IDs and they were under age at the time and said they'd been served there before and I was like naw yall get outta here now
and the regional manager told her as diplomatically as possible to fuck off lmao
the main issue was we had customers ahead of her, and because we were brand new we were only using half the grill (it was el pollo loco) to ease into it (it was policy for new stores)
so if we let her skip ahead they would've taken literally all the chicken we had
and everyone else would';ve had to wait an hour for more to be made
so it's like... bad timing on your part lady we can't help you
I used to work at a tex Mexican place and she would always ask for all the extras on her shit and then bitch and complain about the price
the funniest thing i saw as a cashier i think was the person who came up with a print out of a coupon. they obviously found it on google images, it was horribly jpg artifacted, and all i could make out was the expiration year in the terms and conditions. the year listed was 4 years beforehand
that reminds me, when i worked at home depot we as cashiers were authorized to give up to $50 in discounts to customers if they asked (like if a coupon wasn't working or something) because it was easier to just shut up the customers instead of starting an argument
anything more needed manager approval but below that? sure whatever
of course we weren't REQUIRED to do this every time but if like a customer went "yeah that associate said this was $10 off" i could go "okay sure"
but if it was blatantly a lie and not a thing i could be like "nope"
"do you have a rewards card? no? get fucked then"
I was about to say my mom is old and old school and she still knows how to that at least
what's funny is since i'm with Nissan now sometimes people chat in with a problem about rewards points. those aren't corporate managed those are dealership managed
so i get to tell them "complain to the dealership lol"
maddy just brought up a good example. home depot somewhat recently changed how the veteran program worked (i was there when this was instituted) so it's via the app instead of on a card
this is so that spouses who aren't military (or people stealing cards) can't get the benefits
aka only people who fought for the country get the benefits
people did not like this lol
i remember one lady got so mad and a manager had to come and they basically went "bring your husband then?"
like as long as the veteran is there it's fine
that's why home depot changed the veteran program
i remember another lady was like THIS IS WHY I PREFER LOWES THEY DON'T DO THIS
i worked at lowes before home depot. they already were doing that
someone i know once referred to these funny stories we're sharing now as a reward for suffering through this stuff

In other news I did some labbing for spin method Ruins jump
Angle range seems slightly narrower but can increase the timing window as high as 4f depending on angle
With my testing, perfect notch is 2f with spin method whereas it was 1f with walk method
However, I'm beginning to wonder if or how much loading zone position matters
I assume FP places you in the center of the loading zone when using the warps (at least by default), is that accurate?
But if you hold up-left from the previous room, you end up at the top of the loading zone, right?
I'm asking bc I got a different answer testing FP warp vs just walking from the previous room
Different enough for notched angle to be 1f vs 2f, it seems
It seems like a messy first half of run but good time saves second half
Yeah there's an extra frame of leeway for a perfect angle when warping as opposed to walking up-left into the lz
But if the lz does put you in a more-or-less central location spin method should be pretty consistent in terms of angle
Is there anywhere in a speedrun you'd normally need to buffer a spin angle?
